comments:
I don't know if this is really a webtools problem, but it appears to be.  I guessed at the component from the traceback.

Version: Eclipse M20060802-0800 with WebTools 1.5 200606092300
Steps:
1. bring up Eclipse
2. create a new Java Project
3. Create a new java class within that project (no special contents)
4. in the .java file for the class, use the context menu to select Run As->Run On Server

Error: A message dialog pops up with "Server Error" (correct), and a weird exception gets added to the log

Note: I do not get this error on a 3.2 Eclipse that does not have webtools installed (and the "Server Error" dialog text is different).
eclipse.buildId=M20060802-0800
java.version=1.5.0_06
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -data C:\AppDevStudio321\Workspaces\bugtest -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

Error
Wed Aug 23 08:52:08 EDT 2006
Plug-in "org.eclipse.ui.ide" was unable to instantiate class "org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.model.FileInputAdapterFactory".

java.lang.IllegalAccessException: Class org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.osgi.RegistryStrategyOSGI can not access a member of class org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.model.FileInputAdapterFactory with modifiers ""

This was actually done with an IBuild of 3.2.1 and WTP 1.5.1. It appears to be Eclipse 321M0802 and WTP 151M0811
This appears to me to be an Eclipse bug that just happens to not appear until you use WTP for a particular evaluation. Moving to platform team.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 153766 ***

traces.message: Class org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.osgi.RegistryStrategyOSGI can not access a member of class org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.model.FileInputAdapterFactory with modifiers ""
